snippet: Northern and eastern areas of the country, long riven by ethnic conflict, pose a stubborn impediment to the government’s hopes for national peace.
abstract: Myanmar has begun a remarkable transformation over the past two years, edging toward democracy and moving past the legacy of five decades of military rule; country's borderland areas, however, long riven by ethnic conflict, pose a stubborn impediment to the government’s hopes for national peace.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok, and Wai Moe from Chiang Mai, Thailand.

lead_paragraph: Northern and eastern areas of the country, long riven by ethnic conflict, pose a stubborn impediment to the government’s hopes for national peace.

headline.main: Lawlessness on Borders Taints Progress in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Lawlessness on Borders Taints Progress in Myanmar
